translated: Vajravidāraṇanāma-dhāraṇī-tīkā

analyzed: rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa /

original: dpal phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrapāṇi.

original: rgyal ba kun gyi gsang mdzod 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi gsang mdzod 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The one who holds the treasury of secrets of all victors,

original: rgyud kyi don 'byung ston pa'i ngo bo la //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don 'byung ston pa'i ngo bo la //
translated: The essence of the teacher of the arising meaning of the tantras,

original: sgo gsum dang bas 'dud de phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: sgo gsum dang bas 'dud de phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: With devotion, I bow down and pay homage with my three doors,

original: mdo yi rnam bshad bdag gis bya bar 'dod //
analyzed: mdo yi rnam bshad bdag gis bya bar 'dod //
translated: And wish to compose this explanation of the sūtra.

original: de la rdo rje zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: de la rdo rje zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Here, vajra refers to correct wisdom,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma'i dngos po thams cad 'joms pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma'i dngos po thams cad 'joms pa la bya'o //
translated: Which destroys all signs of permanence, impermanence, happiness, and suffering.

original: de nas 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Destroyer means the meaning of destruction.

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ni dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa la bya'o //
translated: Dhāraṇī refers to the non-duality of the expanse and wisdom.

original: de ltar mdo'i bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdo'i bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the sūtra,

original: da dgos 'brel gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da dgos 'brel gyi don ston te /
translated: Now the meaning of the connection is taught.

original: ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ston pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i 'khor dang / gang du bshad pa'i gnas dang / ma nor sdud pa'i sdud pa po dang / gang bshad pa'i mdo'i don to //
analyzed: ma nor bar ston pa'i phyir ston pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i 'khor dang / gang du bshad pa'i gnas dang / ma nor sdud pa'i sdud pa po dang / gang bshad pa'i mdo'i don to //
translated: The teacher, the pure retinue, the place where it is explained, the compiler who gathers without error, and the meaning of the tantra that is explained.

original: de la ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das thugs yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu las ma g-yos kyang nyid kyi che ba dbyung ba'i don du thugs yang dag pa'i sras gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la shod cig par byin gyis brlabs
analyzed: de la ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das thugs yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu las ma g-yos kyang nyid kyi che ba dbyung ba'i don du thugs yang dag pa'i sras gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la shod cig par byin gyis brlabs
translated: The teacher is the Bhagavān. Without moving from the vajra samādhi of the mind, in order to demonstrate his greatness, he blessed the lord of the secret, Vajrapāṇi, his true mind-son, to explain this.

original: nas / sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams mtha' yas pa'i nang du rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i don 'di phyag na rdo rje las rab tu thob pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nas / sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams mtha' yas pa'i nang du rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa'i don 'di phyag na rdo rje las rab tu thob pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the meaning of the vajra subjugator is obtained from Vajrapāṇi in the infinite buddhafields,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus cig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus cig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, “Thus have I heard at one time.”

original: ston pa dang / 'khor dang / sdud pa dang ldan pas na dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang / 'khor dang / sdud pa dang ldan pas na dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is endowed with the teacher, retinue, and compiler, it is called “time.”

original: lan grangs mang du ma gsungs par brgya lam du gsungs pas dus gcig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan grangs mang du ma gsungs par brgya lam du gsungs pas dus gcig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Not speaking many times, he spoke once in a hundred years, so it says at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes pa ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i la bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje la bzhugs te zhes pa ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i la bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One dwelling in the vajra means conquering the four maras.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thugs mnyam par gzhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la thugs mnyam par gzhag pa la bya'o //
translated: Or, it means the Blessed One dwelling in the vajra-like samadhi.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa la bya'o //🔽lag na rdo rje lus thams @187a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa la bya'o // lag na rdo rje lus thams @187a * //
translated: By the power of the Buddha means entering into evenness in samadhi.

original: cad rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: cad rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
translated: The entire body of Vajrapani consecrated as vajra means the perfect wisdom consecrated as vajra-like unconditioned.

original: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: He entered the vajra samadhi.

original: zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor rab tu gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bor rab tu gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: It means dwelling in the essence of perfect wisdom.

original: de nas lag na rdo rje sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mthu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas lag na rdo rje sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mthu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, “by the power of the Buddha” is in order to show the power of Vajrapāṇi immediately upon entering into union with all the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis zhes pa ni klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas char 'bebs pa de bzhin du mthu stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rlabs kyis zhes pa ni klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas char 'bebs pa de bzhin du mthu stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “By the blessing of the Buddha” is in order to generate the power of the nāga king Anavatapta, who causes rain to fall.

original: rdo rje khro bo las byung ba zhes pa ni lag na rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs pa'i mthus dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs las 'thon nas khams gsum gyi dregs pa can rnams btul ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo las byung ba zhes pa ni lag na rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs pa'i mthus dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs las 'thon nas khams gsum gyi dregs pa can rnams btul ba'o //
translated: “Arisen from the wrathful vajra” is that by the power of the blessing of Vajrapāṇi, the deities of the maṇḍala arise from the body, speech, and mind of all the wrathful ones and tame the haughty ones of the three realms.

original: rdo rje snying pos rab tu smras te zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa des sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos rab tu smras te zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pa des sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: “Vajra heart, well spoken” is that because the body, speech, and mind are like indestructible vajras, this is spoken in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: da ni khro bo rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi don thugs ka nas phyung ba'i don te /
analyzed: da ni khro bo rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi don thugs ka nas phyung ba'i don te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the nature of the wrathful ones is the meaning of “arisen from the heart.”

original: mi chod pa /
analyzed: mi chod pa /
translated: The uninterrupted

original: mi shigs pa bden pa zhes pas gshin rje gshed ston te /
analyzed: mi shigs pa bden pa zhes pas gshin rje gshed ston te /
translated: and indestructible indicate Yamantaka.

original: gzung ba'i yul ma grub pas mtshan ma thams cad 'joms pas tho ba bsnams ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul ma grub pas mtshan ma thams cad 'joms pas tho ba bsnams ba'o //
translated: Since the object of apprehension is not established, all signs are destroyed, so he holds a hammer.

original: rtsa ba'i snying po ma tha las bskyed pas ma tha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i snying po ma tha las bskyed pas ma tha zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is generated from the root essence mata, he is called mata.

original: de bdag gis bsgoms na dngos grub thob ste /
analyzed: de bdag gis bsgoms na dngos grub thob ste /
translated: If one meditates on him, one attains power.

original: dngos grub de bdud kyis bar du mi chod pas mi chod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub de bdud kyis bar du mi chod pas mi chod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that power is not interrupted by Mara, it is called uninterrupted.

original: sku gsung thugs mtshan ma'i rnam rtog gis mi shigs pas na /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs mtshan ma'i rnam rtog gis mi shigs pas na /
translated: Since the signs of body, speech, and mind are indestructible by discursive thought,

original: mi shigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi shigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called indestructible.🔽 The truth indicates Humkara.

original: bden pa zhes pa ni gsung gi ngo bo bden ba dang ldan pas na bden pa zhes bya bas h'um ka ra ston te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes pa ni gsung gi ngo bo bden ba dang ldan pas na bden pa zhes bya bas h'um ka ra ston te /
translated: Since he possesses the truth of the essence of speech, he is called truth.

original: sku gsung thugs mi 'gyur bas na bden pa ste rtsa ba'i sngags ma tha ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs mi 'gyur bas na bden pa ste rtsa ba'i sngags ma tha ma zhes pa'o //
translated: Since body, speech, and mind are unchanging, he is the truth, the root mantra mata.

original: sra ba brtan pa thams cad du thogs pa med pa zhes pas /
analyzed: sra ba brtan pa thams cad du thogs pa med pa zhes pas /
translated: The hard, firm, and unimpeded

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i don ston te /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i don ston te /
translated: indicate the meaning of total victory.

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'khor ba las rgyal ba'i phyir na ye shes kyi 'khor lo bsnams pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar sra bas na sra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'khor ba las rgyal ba'i phyir na ye shes kyi 'khor lo bsnams pa sku gsung thugs rdo rje ltar sra bas na sra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is victorious over afflictions and cyclic existence, it holds the wheel of pristine consciousness. Since body, speech, and mind are like a vajra, it is called “hard.”

original: byang chub kyi sems mi 'gyur bas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi 'gyur bas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the mind of enlightenment is unchanging, it is called “firm.”

original: thugs rdo rje dang brtson 'grus ci la yang thogs pa med pas na thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje dang brtson 'grus ci la yang thogs pa med pas na thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since the mind vajra and diligence are unobstructed in any way, it is “unobstructed.”

original: rtsa ba'i yig @187b 'bru dh'u na las bskyed pas na dhu na dhu na badzra zhes bya ste bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pas na sra ba brtan pa'i dngos grub thob la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yig @187b 'bru dh'u na las bskyed pas na dhu na dhu na badzra zhes bya ste bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pas na sra ba brtan pa'i dngos grub thob la /
translated: Since it is generated from the root syllable dhūṃ, it is called “dhūṃ dhūṃ vajra.” Since one obtains the siddhi of being hard and firm, one cannot be harmed by māras.

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pas na thogs pa med pa'i dngos grub thob ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pas na thogs pa med pa'i dngos grub thob ba'o //
translated: Since one is unobstructed in all ways, one obtains the siddhi of being unobstructed.

original: thams cad du ma pham pa /
analyzed: thams cad du ma pham pa /
translated: One is invincible in all ways.

original: sems can thams cad skag par byed pa /🔽sems can thams cad 'jil bar byed pa ni da ha da ha badzra zhes pas rta mgrin ston te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad skag par byed pa /🔽sems can thams cad 'jil bar byed pa ni da ha da ha badzra zhes pas rta mgrin ston te /
translated: One paralyzes all sentient beings.🔽One destroys all sentient beings.

original: khams gsum sems can thams cad bdud dang dregs pa thams cad las rgyal bas na /
analyzed: khams gsum sems can thams cad bdud dang dregs pa thams cad las rgyal bas na /
translated: Since he conquers all the demons and haughty ones of all sentient beings of the three realms,

original: bdud la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa skrag par byed pa'o //
translated: he terrifies the demons and so forth.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jil bar byed pas na 'jil bar byed ba dang ; nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pas na padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'jil bar byed pas na 'jil bar byed ba dang ; nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pas na padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: Since he subdues attachment and so forth, he is the subduer, and since he is unstained by the faults of afflictions, he holds a lotus.

original: rtsa ba'i snying po da ha las bskyed pas na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i snying po da ha las bskyed pas na /
translated: Since he is generated from the root essence syllable dhrīḥ,

original: da ha da ha badzra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: da ha da ha badzra zhes pa'o //
translated: he is called dhrīḥ dhrīḥ vajra.

original: des ni ha yi gri ba'i don no //🔽rig sngags thams cad gcod par byed pa /
analyzed: des ni ha yi gri ba'i don no // rig sngags thams cad gcod par byed pa /
translated: This is the meaning of the syllable ha.🔽He is the one who severs all awareness mantras,

original: rig sngags thams cad gnon par byed pa /
analyzed: rig sngags thams cad gnon par byed pa /
translated: the one who suppresses all awareness mantras,

original: las thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes pas bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i don bstan te /
analyzed: las thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes pas bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i don bstan te /
translated: and the one who destroys all actions.

original: pas kyi dmod mo rnams dang // gzhan gyi gnod pa thams cad ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis gcod pa dang / gnon pa dang 'joms pas na 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: pas kyi dmod mo rnams dang // gzhan gyi gnod pa thams cad ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis gcod pa dang / gnon pa dang 'joms pas na 'joms pa'o //
translated: Since he severs, suppresses, and destroys all the curses of enemies and all the harm of others through the nature of gnosis, he is the destroyer.

original: rtsa ba'i yi ge pa tsa las bskyed pas na //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yi ge pa tsa las bskyed pas na //
translated: Since he is generated from the root syllable pa,🔽he is called paṃ paṃ vajra.

original: ba tsa pa tsa badzra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ba tsa pa tsa badzra zhes pa'o //
translated: The mantra is vaja bāca pāca vajra.

original: rdzas dang yo byad dang cho ga tshang bar byas na dmod mo'i bye brag thams cad thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang yo byad dang cho ga tshang bar byas na dmod mo'i bye brag thams cad thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the rite with all the substances, articles, and procedures complete, one will be freed from all the different kinds of curses.

original: des ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i don no //
analyzed: des ni bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: gzhan gyi las thams cad 'jigs par byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi las thams cad 'jigs par byed pa //
translated: Destroys all the rites of others

original: gdon thams cad rlag par byed pa //
analyzed: gdon thams cad rlag par byed pa //
translated: Destroys all the grahas

original: gdon thams cad las thar par byed pa zhes pa ni stobs po che'i don ston te /
analyzed: gdon thams cad las thar par byed pa zhes pa ni stobs po che'i don ston te /
translated: Liberates from all the grahas indicates the meaning of Mahābala.

original: thugs rje chen po'i bye brag gis phyir rgol ba thams cad 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i bye brag gis phyir rgol ba thams cad 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: By the power of the different forms of great compassion, one destroys all the adversaries.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis gdon thams cad mi gnas shing rlag par byed pas na rlag par byed pa'o //🔽tshe dang dbang thang 'phrog pa thams cad las thar bar mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis gdon thams cad mi gnas shing rlag par byed pas na rlag par byed pa'o // tshe dang dbang thang 'phrog pa thams cad las thar bar mdzad pas na /
translated: Destroys means that through the wisdom of the Buddha, all the grahas are destroyed and do not remain.

original: gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Liberates from all the grahas means that one is liberated from all the grahas that steal one's life and power.🔽This is the meaning of Mahābala.

original: rtsa ba'i yi ge dhar las bskyed pas na dha ra dha ra badzra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yi ge dhar las bskyed pas na dha ra dha ra badzra zhes pa'o //
translated: The mantra is dhara dhara vajra, because one is generated from the root letter dh.

original: 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa //
translated: He attracts all spirits.

original: rig sngags kyi las thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi las thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
translated: He causes all the activities of the knowledge mantras to be performed.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i don ston te /🔽thabs mkhas pa'i @188a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i don ston te / thabs mkhas pa'i @188a * //
translated: This teaches the meaning of “unconquerable.”

original: thugs rjes 'byung po'i rigs thams cad dbang du bsdus na 'khor bas na 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rjes 'byung po'i rigs thams cad dbang du bsdus na 'khor bas na 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa'o //
translated: With skillful compassion, he subdues all types of spirits and brings them under his control, so he is “he who attracts all spirits.”

original: thugs rje chen po la mnga' brnyes shing legs pa thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes gzhan la ston pa dang / nyams su len du 'jug pas na rig sngags kyi las thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po la mnga' brnyes shing legs pa thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes gzhan la ston pa dang / nyams su len du 'jug pas na rig sngags kyi las thams cad byed du 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is “he who causes all the activities of the knowledge mantras to be performed” because he has attained mastery over great compassion and causes all that is good to be performed, teaching others and causing them to practice.

original: rtsa ba'i yi ge d'a ra ya las bskyed de d'a ra ya d'a ra ya badzra zhes pas gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yi ge d'a ra ya las bskyed de d'a ra ya d'a ra ya badzra zhes pas gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: He is generated from the root letter ḍa, and with “ḍa ra ya ḍa ra ya vajra” he teaches the meaning of “unconquerable.”

original: ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pa /
analyzed: ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pa /
translated: He causes the unaccomplished to be accomplished.

original: grub pa rnams chud mi za bar byed pa 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin pa zhes pas ni mi g-yo mgon po'i don ston te thugs yang dag pas dngos grub ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pas na grub par byed pa'o //🔽grub pa rnams bdud kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar 'grub pas na /
analyzed: grub pa rnams chud mi za bar byed pa 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin pa zhes pas ni mi g-yo mgon po'i don ston te thugs yang dag pas dngos grub ma grub pa rnams grub par byed pas na grub par byed pa'o // grub pa rnams bdud kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar 'grub pas na /
translated: The phrase he who grants all wishes, who causes the attainment of powers not yet attained and the non-loss of powers already attained indicates the meaning of Acyuta, the Lord of the Immutable. He is the cause of attainment because he causes the attainment of powers not yet attained by his pure mind.

original: grub pa rnams chud mi za ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa rnams chud mi za ba'o //
translated: He is the non-loss of powers already attained because he causes the attainment of powers already attained that are not under the sway of Mara.

original: 'dod pa thams cad skong bas na 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin pa'o //🔽rtsa ba'i yi ge d'a ru na las bskyed pas na /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad skong bas na 'dod pa thams cad rab tu sbyin pa'o // rtsa ba'i yi ge d'a ru na las bskyed pas na /
translated: He is the grantor of all wishes because he fulfills all wishes.
